description.narrative: Community actors have improved capacity to provide quality nutrition-promotion and counselling services to adolescents and women of childbearing age, especially those marginalized and in humanitarian situations.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

title.narrative: Niger United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Niger Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Nutrition)
Niger Country Programme Document 2014-2018 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Niger 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Niger Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community actors have improved capacity to provide quality nutrition-promotion and counselling services to adolescents and women of childbearing age, especially those marginalized and in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: The rollout of community IMCI services which integrated IYCF from the outset promises greater sustainability of IYCF results. The validation of the Community Health Strategic Plan, that includes nutrition intervention is a further step forward to guide implementation at community level of nutrition interventions that were up to now only delivered at health facility level. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Existence of a communication strategy to promote behaviors change on feeding practices based on the results of a socio-anthropological study.
Existence of an evaluated pilot on low-dose high-frequency training of community volunteers.
